query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 La gloria di colui che tutto move 2 per l’universo penetra, e risplende 3 in una parte più e meno altrove.
query.result: 1 The glory of the one who moves everything 2 penetrates the universe, and shines 3 more in one part and less in another.

4 In the heaven that receives most of its light 5 I was, and I saw things that he who descends from up there 6 neither knows nor is able to recount;
7 because as our intellect approaches its desire, 8 it delves so deeply 9 that memory cannot follow.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 Veramente quant’ io del regno santo 11 ne la mia mente potei far tesoro, 12 sarà ora materia del mio canto.
query.result: 10 Truly, as much as I was able to treasure in my mind 11 of the holy kingdom, 12 will now be the subject of my song.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
13 O buono Appollo, a l’ultimo lavoro 14 fammi del tuo valor sì fatto vaso, 15 come dimandi a dar l’amato alloro.
query.result: 13 O good Apollo, for the final labor 14 make me such a vessel of your power, 15 as you require to grant the beloved laurel.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
16 Infino a qui l’un giogo di Parnaso 17 assai mi fu; ma or con amendue 18 m’è uopo intrar ne l’aringo rimaso.
query.result: 16 Up until now, one slope of Parnassus 17 was enough for me; but now with both 18 I must enter the remaining arena.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 Entra nel petto mio, e spira tue 20 sì come quando Marsïa traesti 21 de la vagina de le membra sue.

Please translate literally into English.
22 O divina virtù, se mi ti presti 23 tanto che l’ombra del beato regno 24 segnata nel mio capo io manifesti,
25 vedra’mi al piè del tuo diletto legno 26 venire, e coronarmi de le foglie 27 che la materia e tu mi farai degno.
query.result:
22 O divine virtue, if you lend yourself to me 23 so much that the shadow of the blessed kingdom 24 marked in my head I manifest,
25 you will see me at the foot of your beloved tree 26 come, and crown myself with the leaves 27 that the matter and you will make me worthy.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 Sì rade volte, padre, se ne coglie 29 per trïunfare o cesare o poeta, 30 colpa e vergogna de l’umane voglie,
31 che parturir letizia in su la lieta 32 delfica deïtà dovria la fronda 33 peneia, quando alcun di sé asseta.
query.result:
28 So rarely, father, is it gathered 29 to triumph over either a Caesar or a poet, 30 fault and shame of human desires,
31 that the Peneian leaf should give birth to joy on the joyful 32 Delphic deity, when someone thirsts for it.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
34 Poca favilla gran fiamma seconda: 35 forse di retro a me con miglior voci 36 si pregherà perché Cirra risponda.
query.result: 34 A small spark can kindle a great flame: 35 perhaps after me, with better voices, 36 someone will pray so that Cirra will answer.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 Surge ai mortali per diverse foci 38 la lucerna del mondo; ma da quella 39 che quattro cerchi giugne con tre croci,
40 con miglior corso e con migliore stella 41 esce congiunta, e la mondana cera 42 più a suo modo tempera e suggella.
query.result:
37 The lamp of the world rises for mortals through different openings, 38 but from the one 39 that joins four circles with three crosses,
40 with a better course and a better star 41 it comes forth conjoined, and the worldly wax 42 it tempers and seals more to its liking.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
43 Fatto avea di là mane e di qua sera 44 tal foce, e quasi tutto era là bianco 45 quello emisperio, e l’altra parte nera,
46 quando Beatrice in sul sinistro fianco 47 vidi rivolta e riguardar nel sole: 48 aguglia sì non li s’affisse unquanco.
query.result:
43 There it had made morning and here evening 44 such an opening, and almost all that hemisphere was white, 45 and the other part black,
46 when on the left side I saw Beatrice 47 turned and gazing at the sun: 48 never did an eagle fix itself so intently on it.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
49 E sì come secondo raggio suole 50 uscir del primo e risalire in suso, 51 pur come pelegrin che tornar vuole,
52 così de l’atto suo, per li occhi infuso 53 ne l’imagine mia, il mio si fece, 54 e fissi li occhi al sole oltre nostr’ uso.
query.result:
49 And just as a second ray is accustomed 50 to issue from the first and rise upwards, 51 just like a pilgrim who wants to return,
52 so from her act, infused through her eyes 53 into my image, mine was made, 54 and I fixed my eyes on the sun beyond our custom.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
55 Molto è licito là, che qui non lece 56 a le nostre virtù, mercé del loco 57 fatto per proprio de l’umana spece.
query.result: 55 Much is permitted there that is not permitted here 56 to our virtues, thanks to the place 57 made specifically for the human species.

58 I did not endure it for long, nor so briefly, 59 that I did not see it sparkle all around, 60 like iron that comes boiling out of the fire;
61 and suddenly it seemed as if day had been added to day, 62 as if the heavens had been adorned with another sun.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Beatrice tutta ne l’etterne rote 65 fissa con li occhi stava; e io in lei 66 le luci fissi, di là sù rimote.
query.result: 64 Beatrice stood with her eyes fixed on the eternal wheels; 65 and I, my eyes fixed on her, far removed from up there.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
67 Nel suo aspetto tal dentro mi fei, 68 qual si fé Glauco nel gustar de l’erba 69 che ’l fé consorto in mar de li altri dèi.
query.result: 67 In her aspect I became so transformed within, 68 as Glaucus became on tasting the herb 69 that made him a companion of the other gods in the sea.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
70 Trasumanar significar per verba 71 non si poria; però l’essemplo basti 72 a cui esperïenza grazia serba.
query.result: 70 To convey the experience of transhumanization through words 71 would not be possible; therefore, let the example suffice 72 for those to whom grace reserves the experience.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
73 S’i’ era sol di me quel che creasti 74 novellamente, amor che ’l ciel governi, 75 tu ’l sai, che col tuo lume mi levasti.
query.result: 73 If I was only that which you created 74 anew, O love that governs the heavens, 75 you know it, for you raised me up with your light.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
76 Quando la rota che tu sempiterni 77 desiderato, a sé mi fece atteso 78 con l’armonia che temperi e discerni,
79 parvemi tanto allor del cielo acceso 80 de la fiamma del sol, che pioggia o fiume 81 lago non fece alcun tanto disteso.
query.result:
76 When the wheel that you make eternal, 77 O desired one, drew me to itself 78 with the harmony that you attune and discern,
79 then it seemed to me that so much of heaven was kindled 80 with the flame of the sun that no rain or river 81 or lake ever made so vast an expanse.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
82 La novità del suono e ’l grande lume 83 di lor cagion m’accesero un disio 84 mai non sentito di cotanto acume.
query.result: 82 The novelty of the sound and the great light 83 of their cause kindled in me a desire 84 never before felt with such intensity.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
85 Ond’ ella, che vedea me sì com’ io, 86 a quïetarmi l’animo commosso, 87 pria ch’io a dimandar, la bocca aprio
88 e cominciò: «Tu stesso ti fai grosso 89 col falso imaginar, sì che non vedi 90 ciò che vedresti se l’avessi scosso.
query.result:
85 Therefore, she, who saw me as I was, 86 to calm my agitated mind, 87 before I asked, opened her mouth
88 and began: "You yourself make yourself dull 89 with false imagining, so that you do not see 90 what you would see if you had shaken it off.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
91 Tu non se’ in terra, sì come tu credi; 92 ma folgore, fuggendo il proprio sito, 93 non corse come tu ch’ad esso riedi».

Please translate literally into English.
94 S’io fui del primo dubbio disvestito 95 per le sorrise parolette brevi, 96 dentro ad un nuovo più fu’ inretito
97 e dissi: «Già contento requïevi 98 di grande ammirazion; ma ora ammiro 99 com’ io trascenda questi corpi levi».
query.result:
94 If I was divested of my first doubt 95 by her brief, smiling words, 96 I was ensnared in a new, greater one
97 and said: "Once, content, you rested 98 from great astonishment; but now I marvel 99 at how I transcend these light bodies."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
100 Ond’ ella, appresso d’un pïo sospiro, 101 li occhi drizzò ver’ me con quel sembiante 102 che madre fa sovra figlio deliro,
103 e cominciò: «Le cose tutte quante 104 hanno ordine tra loro, e questo è forma 105 che l’universo a Dio fa simigliante.
query.result:
100 Then, after a pious sigh, 101 she turned her eyes toward me with the look 102 that a mother gives her delirious child,
103 and began: "All things have 104 an order among themselves, and this is the form 105 that makes the universe resemble God.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
106 Qui veggion l’alte creature l’orma 107 de l’etterno valore, il qual è fine 108 al quale è fatta la toccata norma.
query.result: 106 Here the high creatures see the imprint 107 of the eternal power, which is the end 108 for which the touched pattern is made.

109 In the order of which I speak, all 110 natures are inclined, by different lots, 111 more or less close to their principle;
112 whence they move to different ports 113 across the great sea of being, and each 114 with an instinct given to it that guides it.

121 Providence, which arranges all this, 122 with its light makes heaven ever tranquil, 123 in which that which has the greatest speed revolves;
124 and now there, as to a decreed place, 125 the power of that cord carries us, 126 which directs whatever it shoots to a joyful mark.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
127 Vero è che, come forma non s’accorda 128 molte fïate a l’intenzion de l’arte, 129 perch’ a risponder la materia è sorda,
130 così da questo corso si diparte 131 talor la creatura, c’ha podere 132 di piegar, così pinta, in altra parte;
133 e sì come veder si può cadere 134 foco di nube, sì l’impeto primo 135 l’atterra torto da falso piacere.

Please translate literally into English.
136 Non dei più ammirar, se bene stimo, 137 lo tuo salir, se non come d’un rivo 138 se d’alto monte scende giuso ad imo.
query.result: 136 You should not marvel more, if I judge correctly, 137 at your ascent, than at that of a stream 138 that descends from a high mountain to the valley below.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
139 Maraviglia sarebbe in te se, privo 140 d’impedimento, giù ti fossi assiso, 141 com’ a terra quïete in foco vivo».
query.result: 139 It would be a marvel in you if, free 140 of impediment, you had remained below, 141 as quiet earth in living fire."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
142 Quinci rivolse inver’ lo cielo il viso.
query.result: 142 Then she turned her face toward heaven.
